characters: 28B. DUKE LETO AND PAUL AGAINST SEA

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: FADE IN to the dark eyes of the mysterious face of the REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO, who sits against smooth black rock. Her eyes are deep blue-within-blue and her skin is a haunting translucent white. Her voice ECHOES as if in a great cavern.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO
dialogues.text: We are the secret of the Universe.

dialogues.speaker: RESPONSE OF TWENTY THOUSAND VOICES
dialogues.text: Bi-la kaifa.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO
dialogues.text: We are the secret of the Universe. We know of spice...the spice called melange...the greatest treasure in the Universe. It exists on only one planet - ours Arrakis, Dune. We know of spice and the Bene Gesserit sisterhood's selective breeding plan of ninety generations to produce the Kwisatz Haderach, the one the spice will awaken.

dialogues.speaker: RESPONSE OF TWENTY THOUSAND VOICES
dialogues.text: Bi-la kaifa.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO
dialogues.text: And now the prophecy... Silence...then a powerful low organ NOTE resounding in the cavernous space.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He will come...the voice from the outer world, bringing the holy war, the Jihad, which will cleanse the Universe and bring us out of darkness. He will have been born of a Bene Gesserit mother.
The Reverend Mother continues speaking of the Prophecy, but we do not hear it. The huge wind organ BLOWS louder and louder, obscuring her voice. The picture FADES.

dialogues.speaker: 1B. KAITAIN
dialogues.text: Home planet of House Corrino and Shadam IV, Emperor of the known universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN to: ...interior of one drop of water. The image changes subtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to a shot revealing the outside of the drop. There is a distant ROARING and within the drop we can see the distorted image of a space ship landing on a sophisticated landing field. 3.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dark landing field, chemicals spill out of the ship in troughs and tank-suited Guildsmen begin to swarm out of a hatch opening. 4. through 6.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EMPEROR is surrounded by crowds of COURTIERS in his Throne Room. Suddenly a GUARD enters from a small door and quickly crosses to ANOTHER GUARD. A warning SOUND begins. The Emperor turns nervously. Guards quickly begin to clear the large room. Several women are rushed toward us to a door beyond. One of the woman, IRULAN, stops and turns back for a worried, caring look to her father, the Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irulan. She sees that SARDAUKAR OFFICERS are surrounding him now, speaking to him. Irulan turns and leaves. The Emperor moves away from his officers to the center of the now-empty room. He drops his golden robe from his shoulders. He stands in his elegant black uniform, thinking. The Reverend Mother is ushered in and the Sardaukar Officers leave her alone with the Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Third Stage Guild Navigator will be here within minutes! REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We felt his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall want telepathy during his visit and a report when we're finished. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their minds are so.... They move in strange directions....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forced spice evolution of humans changes many things.... I must sit close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will not permit anyone but me to see him. You must be outside this room.... Do what you can. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your Truthsayer, my lord... (sensing something outside the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is here, my lord. Under the carved inscription "Law is the Ultimate Science", the doors to the Emperor's chambers slide open and FIFTY GUILDSMEN wheel in a forty-foot long giant black box. One of the Guildsmen addresses the Emperor through a translating device. TANKED GUILDSMEN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bene Gesserit witch must leave.
The Emperor looks to the Reverend Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after she has gone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reverend Mother enters through doors and takes a seat on a chair just outside the door. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the Emperor's chamber, the TANK-SUITED GUILDSMEN are arranging themselves in a "V" formation around the box. Suddenly the box opens, slowly and beautifully revealing a huge, thick glass tank. Inside the tank floats a THIRD STAGE NAVIGATOR twenty feet long, much like a cross between a pasty, pale human being and a fleshy grasshopper. The tank is filled with swirling orange spice-gas, and Guildsmen continuously vacuum up the toxic chemical spills dripping from under the tank. Suddenly the Guild Navigator swims towards the Emperor. His head is enormous and fleshy, like a huge grasshopper head -- the eyes are totally deep blue. His voice is a high, fleshy whispering and an intricate electrical apparatus in the front of the tank translates into English and broadcasts it into the room. NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have just folded space from Ix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?... How was your journey? NAVIGATOR (after a long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many machines on Ix... new machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes?
NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than those on Richesse.. You are transparent... I see many things... I see plans within plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?... Usually there is a problem when one of you makes a visit. No answer. NAVIGATOR (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is within the problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the Emperor's chamber the Reverend Mother sits, her eyes closed, straining.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER'S MENTAL IMAGE
dialogues.text: A very blurred scene of the Emperor with the Guild Navigator. She is not getting the English version but a much different language version which is fascinating to listen to. A lilting, sing-song monologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see two Great Houses -- House Atreides, House Harkonnen -- feuding... I see you behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The Navigator breathes the spice-gas heavily and swishes gently in his tank. NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must share with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atreides house is building a secret army!... using a technique unknown to us... a technique involving sound. The Duke is becoming more popular in the Landsraad... he could threaten me.... I have ordered House Atreides to occupy Arrakis to mine the spice... thus replacing their enemies the Harkonnens.... House Atreides will not refuse because of the tremendous power they think they will gain. Then, at an appointed time Baron Harkonnen will return to Arrakis and launch a sneak attack on House Atreides... I have promised the Baron five legions of my Sardaukar terror troops. NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Harkonnens will rid you of House Atreides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the Reverend Mother is seeing the scene mentally. She suddenly sees and flinches.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER'S MENTAL IMAGE
dialogues.text: The Guild Navigator turns toward her and comes very close to her. We hear the Navigator speak to her. NAVIGATOR (to Reverend Mother, mentally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Mother... I will give you the Tleilaxu Path.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (an excited whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chance for escape? But for whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?... If this visit has anything to do with spice...
The Guild Navigator shudders and swishes quite violently in his tank. NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISTEN TO ME!! The spice must flow... the spice has given me accelerated evolution for four thousand years... it has enabled you to live two hundred years... the spice helps make the sapho juice, which gives the red-lipped mentats the ability to be living computers... the secret side of spice... the water of life.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He shouldn't speak of this...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...gives the Bene Gesserit sisterhood the metaphysical ability to see beyond...to have superior powers... Our power to fold space is in the spice... Without us, your empire would be lost on isolated scattered planets... You would be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can assure you... NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not interrupt!!! Do not speak lightly of the spice... ONE SMALL POINT...

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here it comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ourselves... foresee a slight problem within House Atreides.... Paul.... Paul Atreides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, of course, Duke Leto Atreides... his father.
Page missing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High on the rock cliff stands Castle Caladan, Its appearance us dark and medieval. There is a window on the seaward wall lit from within...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...by a drifting glowglobe. Paul sits at an L-shaped table studying filmbooks and maps of Arrakis and the Universe.

dialogues.speaker: FILMBOOK
dialogues.text: We SEE vast star fields and galaxies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are now... nineteen light years beyond...

dialogues.speaker: FILMBOOK
dialogues.text: We SEE the galaxies move as we HEAR a HUM. PAUL (V.O.) (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... beyond Epsilon Alangue... is Arrakis. We HOLD on this, then we see Arrakis grow larger in the filmbook screen and we SEE it is a planet of vast deserts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does look dry....

dialogues.speaker: FILMBOOK
dialogues.text: The picture grows larger again, and we see the Arrakeen Valley.
FILMBOOK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each day the palms along the outer wall of the Palace at Arrakeen consume enough water to sustain the lives of one hundred men. The palms were placed by the Harkonnens to flaunt their water wealth in front of the city Fremen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the Harkonnens from here?

dialogues.speaker: FILMBOOK
dialogues.text: The star fields and galaxies move slightly then. PAUL (V.O.) (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!... Geidi Prime and the Baron Harkonnen... the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: In the background, FOOTSTEPS grow louder, pounding on thick wooden floors. THUFIR HAWAT, GURNEY HALLECK and DR. YUEH enter. Paul has his back to the door. Thufir suddenly looks perturbed when he notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Thufir, I'm sitting with my back to the door. Hawat suppresses a smile. PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you, Dr. Yueh and Gurney coming down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those sounds could be imitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd know the difference. Paul rises and turns to face them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Perhaps he would at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father sent you to test me. Music then? Thufir scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No music. I'm packing this for the crossing. Shield practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shield practice? Gurney... we had practice -- this morning..... I'm not in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the mood?! Mood's a thing for cattle and love play... not fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sorry enough. Gurney draws his knife.

dialogues.speaker: 25B. SHIELD EFFECT
dialogues.text: Gurney activates his body shield, sending a shimmering FORCE FIELD around his body. He advances swiftly toward Paul. Paul snaps on his FORCE FIELD, draws his knife and jumps back, collecting himself hurriedly for the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice sounding strange through the forcefield)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard yourself for true! Gurney leaps high, then forward, pressing a furious attack. Paul falls back. The shield edges CRACK loudly as they touch each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into Gurney? He's not faking. Paul presses forward and the fight moves quickly around the room. The smell of ozone grows stronger as the shields hit and SPARK off one another. Paul directs a parry downwards, turns, and leads Gurney against the table, plunging at just the right moment to pin Gurney against the table top with his blade right at Gurney's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strange shielded voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you seek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strange shielded voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... the slow blade penetrates the shield... but look down. Paul looks and sees Gurney's blade at his groin. GURNEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have joined each other in death. However, you did seem to finally get the "mood".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you really have drawn my blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd fought one whit below your abilities I'd have scratched you a good one. Paul stands and snaps off his shield as does Gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have been so serious here lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I sensed the play in you lad, but this can no longer be play. Tomorrow we leave for Arrakis! Arrakis is real. The Harkonnens are real. Thufir, Yueh, Gurney and Paul stare at each other for a moment in silence. Dr. Yueh moves forward and begins to take Paul's pulse rate and to collect other data with a small black machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Yueh, do you have any information on the worms of Arrakis?
DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have obtained a filmbook on a small specimen... only 125 meters long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only?! They smile at each other. DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are have been documented sightings of worms as large as 450 meters in the deep desert -- far from where we'll be in Arakeen.... The desert belt and the south polar regions are marked forbidden.... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storms and the worms. Is it true, that the sand can blow at seven hundred kilometers per hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can render flesh to dust in minutes. And these dry winds can generate tremendous static electricity in the atmosphere. Our body shields won't have enough power to operate in the open air on Arrakis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how do the Fremen survive there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know much about the Fremen... They live in the deep desert... some of them in the cities and they have blue- within-blue eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes -- yes, yes... saturation of the blood by the spice -- melange. Could the spice affect us in other ways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many dangers exist on Arrakis. For one, we know the Harkonnens would not have given up their CHOAM company contract so easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Harkonnens are our enemies, yes... but behind them, I suspect, is the Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will make a formidable Duke! Paul bows. THUFIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now remember... the first step in avoiding a trap is knowing of its existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  But if it is a trap then why are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our new army. (in the same breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Yueh, put the weirding module on him. Thufir, noticing a SQUAD OF GUARDS at the other end of the training room, calls out to them. THUFIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear and lock the room. Gurney activates a series of locks.  LIGHTS GLOWS above each doorway. THUFIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: 25C. ROBOT FIGHT
dialogues.text: Suddenly a FIGHTER ROBOT lowers from the ceiling. As the robot begins to rotate and go through several frightening, complicated movements, Dr. Yueh places a plastic device around Paul's neck.  He tightens it around the Adam's apple above Paul's voice box. Paul turns and emits a very strange, powerful sound through the weirding module as he rushes towards the robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yueh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precise control....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is empty in the foreground but in the distance a changing of the guard is seen.
26A. through 26B.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks down the stairway.  In the distance, moving troops are packing Atreides belongings. Beyond, Paul sees some troops carrying a large bull's head.  The horns are covered with dried blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull that killed my grandfather... is this an evil omen? Suddenly, DUNCAN IDAHO appears from behind the giant black head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. (they shake hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on my way to say goodbye to you.  I have to go on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  I wish you were coming with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something for your father.  He wants to talk to you. (places hand on Paul's chest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you in Arrakis.  May the hand of God be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the hand of God be with us all, Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks to meet his father near the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (diffident)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for joining me, Paul. (voice tired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be good to get to our new home and have all this upset behind us.
28A. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: 28B. DUKE LETO AND PAUL AGAINST SEA
dialogues.text: They look out over the sea.  A huge wave crashes below. The Duke turns to Paul. DUKE LETO (CONT'D) (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thufir Hawat has served House Atreides three generations....  He swears you are the finest student he's ever taught. Yueh, Gurney and Duncan say the same.... It makes me feel very proud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be proud of me. Paul smiles up at his father.  The WIND blows the Duke's hair and behind him stands the castle and the green and black Atreides banner against the night sky beyond.  The RAIN starts again -- lightly.  Paul takes a closer look at the Atreides banner moving in the wind. DUKE LETO (studying the dark sea below)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss the sea... but a person needs new experiences... they jar something deep inside, allowing him to grow.  Without change, something sleeps inside us... and seldom awakens... The sleeper must awaken. Paul's attention goes to his father's hand where he sees the Duke's signet ring.  Again he smiles at his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29. through 29A.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is sweating during his sleep and WHISPERS as if struggling with some disturbing thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrakis... Dune... Desert Planet...Arrakis... Desert Planet... moving... moving.

dialogues.speaker: DARK WATER
dialogues.text: We see Paul's dream. It is very dark. PAUL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrakis... Dune... Desert Planet. Suddenly a drop falls into the black, and white hot widening rings appear on the dark water's surface. Darkness again. Two moons rise in the darkness. As the second appears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second moon, your moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark again. A figure turns toward Paul. It is a BEAUTIFUL GIRL in deep shadow. She speaks. BEAUTIFUL GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me of your homeworld, Usul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU Paul's face in fitful sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a small stone courtyard, the back-lit figure of a woman moves towards us through the heavy RAIN and darkness. As she nears us, the large, protective glowglobe overtakes her and in an instant we see a beautiful woman -- JESSICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  know she has come to test him... no man has ever been tested with the box... only Bene Gesserit women. I may lose my son. The doors open, she meets the Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam (the Emperor's truthsayer) and takes her back toward the Castle. The rain rushes loudly into the storm drains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrakis... Dune... Desert planet... moving... moving. CU Paul's face. Paul's eyes snap open. He hears footsteps outside his door. As the door opens he closes his eyes, however, and he pretends to be asleep. Jessica and the Reverend Mother enter and stand in the doorway looking at him. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll salvage what we can... but I can tell you.. dear God... for the father... nothing. Jessica turns to the Reverend Mother, stunned! She turns back to look at Paul. Her hands tremble.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you really think that you could bear the Kwisatz Haderach?... How dare you! REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My greatest student... and my greatest disappointment.... He's awake!... He's listening to us. (considering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... Ready yourself, young Paul Atreides... I want to see you in your mother's chamber in one quarter of an hour. She turns and walks away. Jessica remains at the door and calls out to Paul in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?... This is very important... Jessica leaves, closing the door behind her. Paul sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwisatz Haderach?... For the father... nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica and the Reverend Mother enter. It is quite dark. Jessica WHISPERS a code number and a glowglobe LIGHTS on a very dim setting.
REVEREND MOTHER (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica... You were told to bear only daughters to the Atreides... Jessica!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It meant so much to him... REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought only of a Duke's desire for a son?... Desires don't figure in this! An Atreides daughter could have been wed to a Harkonnen heir and sealed the breach. We may lose both blood lines now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vowed never to regret my decision. I'll pay for my own mistakes. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your son will pay with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a dim glowglobe, the DUKE is writing a note on a scroll-like piece of paper. Finishing reading, the Duke seals the message in a cylinder and presses his signet ring, with a red hawk symbol of House of Atreides, into a hole, which seals the cylinder with a swift HISSING. He pauses, studying the metal tube. With a VOICE COMMAND, he extinguishes the glowglobe above him. He leans back in his chair as lightning flashes outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Paul enters the room and Jessica closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, this is the Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam. She is going to... observe you... (to Reverend Mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...
REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, you know it must be done. I enjoin you to stand guard at the door and practice the meditation of peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Reverence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she fear? (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul... please, Paul... listen to the Reverend Mother and do what she tells you. Jessica leaves the room. The Reverend Mother speaks to Paul using The Voice, a Bene Gesserit training which permits an adept to control others merely by selected tone shadings of the voice. It sounds as if two people are talking -- one normal and the other gutteral and slightly electronic. The effect is strange, yet subtle. REVEREND MOTHER (using The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you come here. Paul finds he cannot help but obey her, yet he fights her controlling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's using The Voice. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She sees him struggling. REVEREND MOTHER (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some strength there. Surprising! (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. The Reverend Mother holds up a green metal cube.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See this... Put your right hand in the box. Paul stares at the hole in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the box? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain. Just then, she raises one hand to his neck. Paul sees a glint of metal. He tries to back away.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP! Put your hand in the box. Paul's hand goes in. Fear passes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Voice again. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hold at your neck the gom jabbar. Don't pull away or you'll feel that poison. A Duke's son must know about many poisons -- this one kills only animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting a Duke's son is an animal? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us say I suggest you may be human. Your awareness may be powerful enough to control your instincts. Your instincts will be to remove your hand from the box. If you do so you will die. You will feel an itching -- there... see? Now the itching becomes burning... heat, upon heat, upon heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It burns. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)(struggling to compose himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear... I will permit it to pass over me and through me.
The Reverend Mother moves her face up to his. Her ancient face with its metal teeth gleaming inches away breathes hotly. She is smiling. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel the flesh crisping?

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: Paul's inner mind sees his hand on fire with all sorts of sores. The skin is bubbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flesh dropping off.

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: He pictures this. The destruction of his hand is complete -- now only blood spurts out and burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's face registers extreme pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cannot help the explosion)

dialogues.speaker: THE PAIN
dialogues.text: REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!! ENOUGH!! Kull wahad! No woman child ever withstood that much. I must have wanted you to fail. Take your hand out of the box and look at it, young human.... Do it! Paul pulls his hand out of the box. No sign of anything wrong. He turns his hand, flexes his fingers. He looks to the Reverend Mother.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain by nerve induction... A human can resist any pain. Our test is crisis and observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the truth of it.
REVEREND MOTHER (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could he be the one?... Maybe... but will he be ours to control? (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when people speak the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it. Suddenly the Reverend Mother holds her hand against Paul's head. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER'S MENTAL IMAGE
dialogues.text: She sees a blurred image of Paul's earlier dream. She sees the beautiful girl turn. She hears a muffled voice say "Tell me of your homeworld, Usul".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother wants you to tell me about your dreams. I only want to know one thing.... Do they come true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of them... I know which ones will. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you are the Kwisatz Haderach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? REVEREND MOTHER (profoundly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The person who can be many places at once... the one who bridges space and time.... He will look where we cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know of the Water of Life?... the Truthsayer drug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard of it.
REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very dangerous... very painful. The Bene Gesserit sisterhood drink it to see within.... There is a place terrifying to us... to women. It is said a man will come... the Kwisatz Haderach... he will go where we cannot... Many men have tried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they try and fail? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried and died.... (she calls out loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica! Jessica enters immediately and sees with great relief that Paul is still active. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sense your teachings in him. Ignore the regular order of training. His safety requires The Voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard enough of my safety... What about my father?... I heard you talking. You speak as if he was dead. Well, he isn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! She tries to hold him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he isn't... and he won't die... Tell me he won't die! REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can be done has been done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHER! Tell me! The Reverend Mother covers herself and moves quickly to the door.
42A. Through 45.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOME PLANET OF HOUSE HARKONNEN - As seen from space, the black planet as we saw it in Paul's filmbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of the planet is a vast sea of black oil. A small cable car traverses high above the sea toward a gigantic black city in the shape of a rectangular box over 100 stories high. Before the city there are rows of huge black towering steel heads atop massive furnaces. SMOKE billows out of their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cable car stands PITER. In one hand he holds the cylinder with DUKE Leto's ring imprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. It is by the juice of Sapho that thoughts acquire speed - The lips acquire stains - The stains become a warning - It is by will alone I set my mind in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the interior of Geidi Prime, we are in a green porcelain room. Two large Harkonnen soldiers, using large hoses, are washing down the walls and floors of the room. WE MOVE DOWN into the water rushing along the floor towards troughs. Closer, WE SEE bits of flesh, hair, and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car zooms past gigantic faces, and the furnaces far below ROAR with tremendous power. The city now looms gigantic and overpowering -- millions of electrical cables stretch off the top into dark energy taps above the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the city the cable car passes into a huge inner chamber filled with open-topped lime green porcelain rooms with tremendous electrical lines criss-crossing above. 51.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of a huge steam boiler, the cable car stops and Piter gets out, steps down steel stairs and enters a porcelain room where the Baron is being treated by a DOCTOR for sores on his face and body. The doctor uses a lasbeam on a big sore on the Baron's lips. The Baron is sickly and hugely fat and sweaty and looks like he has been sickly for some time. He turns to Piter as he enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piter. Piter moves up to the Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atreides will be leaving Caladan soon, Baron, and I have here your answer from Duke Leto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Leto say, Piter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wishes to inform you that Vendetta -- as he puts it, using the ancient tongue, the art of Kanly -- is still alive. He does not wish to meet or speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing; angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made my peace gesture... the forms of Kanly have been obeyed. He throws down the cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you instructed me, I have enlightened your nephews concerning my plan t...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan to crush the Atreides.  Feyd, Rabban... go quietly... no other great house of the Landsraad must ever know of the Emperor's aid to the Baron.  The entire Landsraad would turn against the Baron and the Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the pick in there Pete And turn it round real neat. His assistant does so. Rabban breaks open a squood (living food).  The squood makes a tiny SCREAM, then Rabban drinks the blood and bodily fluids.  He throws the empty container of tiny animal meat into the dark water trough running through the center of the room. Across the room, TWO HARKONNEN SOLDIERS enter, holding big guns on a BOY who is wearing white pants.  The Baron smiles when he sees the boy, who is deeply afraid.  The guards force the boy to arrange violet flowers on a stand by the far wall opposite the Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the Baron watches the boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so beautiful my Baron Your skin, love to me Your diseases lovingly cared for For all eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have Arrakis back for myself... he who controls the Spice, controls the universe... and what Piter didn't tell you is we have control of someone who is very close to Duke Leto.  This person... this traitor... will be worth more to us than ten legions of Sardaukar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the traitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell you who the traitor is or when we'll attack.  However, the Duke will die before these eyes and he'll know that it is I -- Baron Vladimir Harkonnen -- who encompasses his doom.

The Baron gives a hand signal and seven gates in the wall open, emitting tremendous SOUNDS.  Suddenly the Baron begins to float straight up, twenty-five feet in the air.  It is a frightening sight.  He floats down under the giant, humming electrical tube light and rubs his head and body with a black fluid which drips from tiny holes in either side of the pink glow.  Feyd and Rabban watch nervously.  The Attendants stand completely still with fear. The Baron swoops down to the Boy, who stands petrified.  The Harkonnen guards smile nervously as they step slightly backwards.  The boy begins SCREAMING as the Baron pulls the boy's heart plug, located in his chest.  The violet flowers are bumped and disarrayed by the violence which ensues.  Then the Baron turns smiling to Feyd as the SOUNDS continue to roar. 52A. through 52B.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRUM CORPS pounds out a powerful cadence in front of a water and cannon show as the Duke, Paul and Jessica mount the steel stairs to their ship.  In the doorway, they turn back for a final look. The Duke places a hand on Paul's shoulder.  We see the signet ring.  Jessica is there.  She tries to get Paul to look at her but he scowls and turns to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away) (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must not fear.  Fear is the mind- killer... the little death that brings total obliteration... The door of the spaceship closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3,415 Atreides ships are approaching the Guild Heighliner, which is staggeringly colossal.  The Atreides ships look like dots next to the sun.  The Duke's ship enters the frame and moves toward the Heighliner. 53A. through 54.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Jessica and Duke Leto look out the forward viewing glass as tiny lights move outside in the darkness. They hear and feel their ship stop with a huge, echoing, metallic jolt. They look at each other in the silence which follows. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon they'll begin to fold space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far off in the control rooms.... Travelling without moving. They wait. 56.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pass through electrical shields into a 2,000-foot high control room filled with orange spice gas. On the floor are large gratings covering an exhaust and filtering system. Tons of spice gas are being converted into the clouds of gas along a wall of machinery. From within a dark metal tunnel comes a Guild Navigator. He exits the tunnel and swims through the gas 1,000 feet to a six-dimensional layered miniature replica of the entire Universe. The Navigator emits a long piece of light from his mouth which travels to one edge of the Universe and changes into a likeness of the planet Caladan. The Navigator turns and emits another piece of light which travels to the opposite side of the Universe. It changes into a likeness of Arrakis. The Navigator begins to put his slender fingers in amongst the stars and he emits SOUNDS and bursts of light into the mass of stars and galaxies. The Universe begins to vibrate and elongate, then to curve. Electrical lightening traverses from Caladan to Arrakis as the Universe bends into a U-shape. Arrakis submerges deep into the light. The navigator swims to the point where Arrakis disappeared. He begins to pull and tear a hole in the Universe. Stars like sparks and SOUNDS and rings of light appear, along with a roaring WIND. The Navigator swims deep into this hole through the rings of light. The Navigator becomes more and more transparent, until he's lost in darkness. The sounds fade.
58. through 60.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the real planet Arrakis appears and the giant Heighliner materializes above it. 61. through 63A.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a brownish-orange haze appears the dusty valley of Arrakeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atreides ship has landed at Arrakeen. The door is open - the family walk down the steps - DUKE LETO with his dog - PAUL and JESSICA. 64A. through 64C.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... clusters of troops standing at attention around the enormous dark, cool doorway as the Duke, Paul and Jessica enter the Palace. 65A. through 65B.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atreides banner is raised on the top of the Palace. 66.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Atreides army soldiers milling, YELLING noisily. 68.  INT. PASSAGEWAY - ARRAKEEN PALACE - DAY. In a darkened passageway, fans turn, casting deep, slow-moving shadows. SOUNDS ECHO in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room of technicians and electronic gear. The SIGNALS are being heard and interpreted. ATREIDES TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harkonnens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far in the distance in deep black rock, Harkonnen spies move, carrying strange electronic equipment. 71.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thufir marches down a hallway with a squad of TROOPS with electronic gadgetry, LIGHTS and SOUNDS going constantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a radio microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't the shield up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the basement, Atreides engineers are removing a complicated device from heavy machinery. A MAN radios back to Thufir. ATREIDES RADIO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found and removed another sabotage device. I think it will go up now.

The engineers activate a series of atometric Holtzman generators. Suddenly SOUNDS begin. The machines start; at first low, then they WHINE upwards to a high pitch. When the pitch is steady, a series of levers are pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after the second set of levers is pulled, a huge house shield is seen going up in a box shape, encompassing the Palace with SHIMMERING protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a small window, Thufir observes the shield with a critical eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice; worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found these sabotage devices too easily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two giant glowglobes drift into the Great Hall where Jessica and Dr. Yueh stand watching a giant bull's head is being hung above the massive fireplace. The MOVING TROOPS are unpacking crates and organizing furnishings. Jessica watches them. Distant SOUNDS reverberate inside an elaborate air vent beside them. DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen here.... You can here the people of Arrakeen outside.... Can you here the cry "Soo Soo Sook" of the water sellers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many reminders of the scarcity of water. DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you noticed the line of palms along the wall... the Harkonnen put them in... to flaunt their water wealth in front of these people.... Each day those palms take enough water to sustain the life of one hundred men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you say Harkonnen... I didn't know you had so much reason to hate them. DR. YUEH (swiftly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife... you didn't know my wife... they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me... (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... His wife was Bene Gesserit too... the signs are al over him.... They must have killed here. Jessica sees a droplet of sweat break out on Yueh's cheek. DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm unable to talk about it. Above them a series of iron curtains begins to open over deep rock window slots, sending  narrow shafts of light down across the room. TWO ATREIDES WOMEN in uniform approach. ATREIDES WOMAN #1 (referring to several robed figures standing in the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady... the local people... the maids and servants await your inspection. Hawat has cleared them. Dr. Yueh turns to Jessica. DR. YUEH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Harkonnens may have tampered medically.... please wait. He turns a yellow light on a moves it over the crowd. The yellow light beam plays over the blue- within-blue eyes. One of the women, the Shadout Mapes, watches Jessica continuously. Yueh's hand shakes slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice; noticing Yueh's hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hiding something -- holding something back. (She studies his face closely.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just his wife... He's a good man though. He's probably trying to save my feelings... (We see her mouth.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use The Voice... make him tell me... It would only shame him. (We see her eyes.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must place more trust in my friends. (We see Yueh turn toward her, fearful.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wanders through the darkened passageways alone, his footsteps echoing as goes. He takes pleasure observing the details of the rock Palace but all the while he feels an uneasiness -- a feeling of fear builds in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters a small bedroom and sits down on the bed. He opens the filmbook, and activates it.

dialogues.speaker: FILMBOOK
dialogues.text: We SEE a gigantic carryall lower down above a spice harvester and pick it up off the desert floor as a narrator speaks over. NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One carryall handles four spice mining teams; however, it will fly only two harvesters at a time. Today, we have nine hundred and thirty harvesters and nine hundred and eighty-one carryalls....

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Paul looks up. Across the room he sees a tray of small pastries which have been laid out. He goes to them and scans them with his poison detector, which he carries on his belt. A pleasant tone SOUNDS and the word "safe" appears in green light. Paul takes a pastry bites it and turns back towards the bed. Suddenly he stops. He looks at the pastry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spice... As he continues eating he notices the sunlight through the slates over the window begins to GLOW white hot. Paul's eyes are intense as the light GLOWS brilliantly. PAUL (CONT'D) (whispering inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible purpose.... What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RED DROPLETS
dialogues.text: Some red droplets appear rushing through the white light. Three images follow:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blurred Guild Navigator.
Page Missing
SHADOUT MAPES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Shadout Mapes... the housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Fremen... Could she be the operator? No... SHADOUT MAPES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must cleanse the way between us.... You saved my life... and we  Fremen pay our debts. It's known to us that you've a traitor in your midst. Who it is we cannot say but we're certain of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traitor... Before he can speak the Shadout Mapes is gone -- running off down the passageway. Jessica enters. PAUL (CONT'D) (looks to Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a traitor among us. 80A. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running TROOPS storm down the hallway with electronic gear and big stun guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thufir walks quickly toward SEVERAL TROOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set up a sonar probe immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Yueh sticks his head out the doorway as SEVERAL TROOPERS run past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto is calling on a radio phone. GENERALS surround him, as well as Gurney. DUKE LETO (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thufir?... anything?... keep looking. (Inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a traitor... God help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPS come off an elevator. The glow-span indicates the very bottom floor of 18 sub-floors. The ground is uneven rock and the ceiling is low. The troops fan out shining chemical lamps here and there. A soldier suddenly stops. Ahead in his light is a dead Harkonnen -- bloody vomit dried around his mouth. He lies beside an electronic device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Yueh covers his face with his hands in a darkened room... sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEARCHLIGHTS sweep over the faces of City Fremen who are sitting or moving solemnly around the outer wall of the Palace. Some are chanting "Mahdi" and "Lisan al-Gaib." Others hold up one open hand as a sign they feel the messiah is near. A slow-moving spike- backed dog sucks ants up out of a small anthill; he snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkened Hall we can HEAR the distant sound of the Fremen reverberating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto sits with Paul, Thufir, EIGHT GENERALS and SIX SUB-LIEUTENANTS. The Duke's small dog wanders under the table and rests his head on the Duke's boot. In front of Thufir is a device FLASHING brilliant light bursts over his face. The others are all talking among themselves. Suddenly Thufir's face turns brilliant red (as red as his sapho-stained lips) and he begins speaking rapidly into the machine in code using a strained high voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mentat voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sector 6 - 80 -- copy the sixth -- the summit -- the eight the quadrant over the ninth plus eighty -- four circles -- weave the eighty and call the fourth copy -- enter nine -- seven by seven a seven the seven call seven B seven -- enter the circles call the sixth copy the sixth over the summit.... eight. The machine FLASHES several bright irregular SIGNALS. Then it stops and HUMS. The blood leaves Thufir's face. THUFIR (CONT'D) (very fast and casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight.... Thufir Hawat... Mentat... Master of Assassins. The hum stops. Thufir turns to Duke Leto. He looks up. Everyone is quiet now. THUFIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Palace is now secure. The city of Arrakeen is under martial law... we have troops here headquartered underground on sub-floors six through ten. The rest of the troops are stationed in Arrakeen and we have some on the airfield. Our new army is still training, but everything is shielded.... With the shielding, we are impenetrable. Dr. Kynes is waiting, Sire, for your inspection of spice mining operations, but since the attempt of the young master, I am against your leaving the Palace. DUKE LETO (very angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attempt failed... Harkonnen captives have already been taken. We must crush the Harkonnen machine on Arrakis.... You all know what to do. (Turning towards Gurney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Gurney! We desperately need more spice miners... many are threatening to leave on the next shuttle. We need spice drivers, weather scanners, dune men ... any with open sand experience. You must persuade them to enlist with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup as the east wind. And they shall gather the captivity of the sand. DUKE LETO (squints at Gurney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very moving, Gurney. On your way... and take care of Dr. Kynes until Paul and I arrive. We will not be prisoners here in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (artfully easing the Duke's anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold as a wild ass in the desert go I forth to my work. Gurney strides off. Thufir sits, contemplating. Paul and Duke Leto smile at each other and shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is sitting in a small room, smiling, reading a note. It reads "I miss you. Leto." She sets the note down. She begins to tremble. She becomes fearful. In her mind she SEES quick images:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blurred Guild Navigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul dead on a stone floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica continues to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must speak with you Leto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside in the passageway, feet suddenly move quietly toward the door to Jessica's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica HEARS this and looks up just as the Shadout Mapes silently enters her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the blue-eyed woman -- waiting for possible danger.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? SHADOUT MAPES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Shadout Mapes, your housekeeper, Noble Born. What are your orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may refer to me as "my lady." I am not noble born. I'm the bound concubine of Duke Leto -- mother of the heir designate.... "Shadout"... that's an ancient word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangely asked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the ancient tongues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the Bhotani Jib and Chakobsa, all the hunting languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the legend says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! The Missionaria Protectiva has been here planting protective legends against a day of Bene Gesserit need. And that day has come. I must play out this sham. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the Dark things and the way of the Great Mother. Miseces prejin. Mapes takes a step backward to flee. JESSICA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know many things. I know you came prepared for violence with a weapon in your bodice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady, I... the weapon was sent as a gift if you should prove to be the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the means of my death should I prove otherwise. (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we will see which way the decision tips. Slowly Mapes reaches into her dress and brings out a sheathed knife. She unleashes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this my lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could only be one thing.... (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crysknife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it not lightly... (very slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know its meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is why this Fremen has taken service with me, to ask that one question. Delay is as dangerous as the wrong answer. Shadout is Chakobsa... knife, in Chakobsa is... maker of death. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a maker... Mapes SCREAMS with elation and grief. JESSICA (CONT'D) (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maker?... Maker is the key word... the tooth of the worm? That was close... (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think that I, knowing the mysteries of the Great Mother, would not know the maker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady, when one has lived with prophecy for so long, the moment of revelation is a shock. Mapes sheathes the blade... slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more here... yes! (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mapes, you've sheathed that blade unblooded. With a GASP Mapes drops the knife into Jessica's hands and opens her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the water of my life! Jessica withdraws the knife from the sheath and, with the blade, scratches a line just above Mapes' right breast. MAPES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are ours.... You are the one. Jessica's eyes stare ahead. She knows these words ring with truth.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Duke, Paul and SEVERAL ARMED GUARDS enter a tunnel to a `thopter landing pad which is illuminated by a shaft of light coming from a chimney-like exit above. DR. KYNES and his Fremen guard are standing next to Gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gurney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is Leto the Just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I made myself clear. You may call him "The Duke," "My lord," or "Sire." And there is a more ancient term you might keep in mind -- "Noble Born."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play out your little comedy while you can off-worlders... Gurney turns and activates a device...

dialogues.speaker: ORNITHOPTER OPENING
dialogues.text: ...which causes the ornithopter behind to fold open ready for flight.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The two parties meet and are introduced. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are Dr. Kynes, the Imperial Ecologist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Gurney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer the more ancient term, planetologist... Noble Born. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my son, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a Fremen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a servant of the His Majesty the Emperor. I have served His Majesty on Arrakis long enough for my eyes to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hiding something. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand we have you to thank for these stillsuits, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are Fremen suits. I hope they fit well, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Your gift is a blessing of the river." Kynes' FREMEN GUARDS, hearing this are siezed with agitation. Kynes QUIETS them, then studies Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mahdi will greet you with holy words and your gifts will be a blessing. (spoken, nonchalantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the desert natives here are a superstitious lot. They mean no harm. With your permission, I will check the security of your suits. Gurney and the guard move forward warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke is to be addresses as...
Kynes comes forward and adjusts the Duke's suit, checking seals and pulling on straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaping forward to protect his Duke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sire! DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right Gurney. Gurney steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a high-efficiency filter and heat exchange system. Perspiration passes through the first layer and is gathered in the second. The salt is separated. Breathing and walking provide the pumping action. The reclaimed water circulates to catchpockets from which you can drink through this tube at your neck. Urine and feces are processed in the thigh pads. Should you be in the open desert, remember to breathe in through your mouth, out through the nose tubes. The Duke is now properly fitted. Kynes places the noseplug into his nose. KYNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a Fremen suit in good working order, one can sustain life for weeks, even in the deep desert. He removes the noseplug. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your permission... Kynes turns to Paul, running his hands over the slick fabric. He stands back with a puzzled expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've worn a stillsuit before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your suit is fitted desert fashion. Who told you how to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. It... seemed the proper way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it is. (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shall know your ways as if born to them. Kyne's Fremen guard are watching Paul very closely now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're wasting time, Sire. Duke Leto, Dr. Kynes, Gurney and Paul enter the ornithopter... 88. Through 89B.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must speak with you Leto! 91. Through 92.          (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the thopter turns slowly as it goes up into the light. 93D. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the Palace's atomic shield we see the blur of the ornithopter pass through a porthole and come out perfect like a gleaming jewel. 93F. Through 94.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Southeast over the Shield Wall. That's where I told your sandmaster to concentrate his harvesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crest the top of the wall which opens out into a black, level expanse of rock, cratered and fractured. On the other side is the huge, seemingly endless plain of sand, the Great Desert. In the hazy distance, flashes of light can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we see a worm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where there is spice and spice mining there are always worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect their territory. Vibrations attract them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've registered him now... a knife is a sheath on his left arm... He's strong... a person born to command... He's hiding many things. (out loud, suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a relationship between the worms and the spice? Kynes turns instantly and stares at Paul. Gurney sees the wonder in Kynes' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young master is a trained Mentat, an advanced student of Prana Bindu has studied under some of the finest teachers in the Universe. Kynes takes a second look at young Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said... they defend the spice sands. As to their relationship with the spice... who knows. 97. Through 97A.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust cloud ahead, Sire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it... spice mining... no other cloud quite like it. See the spotters over it? They're watching for wormsign... the telltale sand waves. Seismic probes on the surface, too Sire... worms can travel too deep for their waves to show... Looks like a good patch of spice. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wormsign? Is it wormsign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!... worm. Big one! You've got sharp eyes Sire.... May I? Kynes grabs the microphone and dials in the correct frequency. 98A. through 99.    (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the window, we see that the sand below is rippling, like water with a big fish just under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio, after having found the frequency)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling Harvester Pad Nine. Wormsign! STATIC... then a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who calls Pad Nine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention the Duke... This is an uncoded channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlisted flight northeast of you... wormsign on intercept course... estimated contact fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have sighting confirmed. Stand by for fix. Contact in sixteen minutes minus. Very precise estimate. Who is on that unlisted flight? Kynes clicks off the radio. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carryall will come and lift off the spice harvester. Try and get in close over the harvester... you'll find this interesting Sire.
The Duke accelerates the ornithopter in the direction of the harvester. Paul can SEE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...huge amounts of sand being spewn out of the gigantic stack atop the metal and plasteel harvester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll work until the very last minute. The yellow cloud of the harvester envelops them. The Duke flies up to get a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotter control... no sign of the carryall... it isn't answering. Everyone looks at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm is eight minutes away, Sire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotter control -- give me a report by the numbers. Over the radio MANY VOICES report they have no contact with the carryall. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it... Harkonnens. He punches a control button and grabs a microphone. DUKE LETO (CONT'D) (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are coming down to take you off the harvester... All spotters are ordered to comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordered by whom?
DUKE LETO (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto Atreides.... Gurney and Paul turn to each other, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... yes, Sire! DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many men do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full crew -- twenty-six men -- but Sire, we can't leave this spice... DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn the spice! Get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the spotters begin landing and the Duke descends directly in front of the harvester which has stopped mining yet emits a tremendous rythmic GRINDING noise. No one is coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gurney nervously scans the sky for enemy ships. A very low, powerful SOUND starts now and the ground begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch opens and MEN come pouring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUKE LETO (yelling at the men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in each of the spotters... You!... over here... run!! The ground is really shaking now.  A tremendous low THUNDERING sound grows along with a high rasping HISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul and Gurney -- yelling over the noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see him yet but he's very close...
DUKE LETO (out loud to himself as he watches the men scrambling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn sloppy -- really damn sloppy. FOUR MEN begin tumbling into the Duke's machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on boys... come on. (Then, to the Duke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be heavy, Sire. The men press on Gurney and Paul.  Paul can feel the fear. The sound is a horrible ROAR and deeper RUMBLING now and the `thopter is vibrating and shaking violently.  The air suddenly begins to SPARK with static electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is... We've got to go. The Duke closes the doorways, surveys the area one last time, then takes the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship strains and lifts off -- slowly. Paul sees the brown powder clumped on the suits of the men... their bluish eyes.  He smells the spice. He begins to feel its affect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice as a blinding light comes and goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spice!... pure un-refined spice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless the Maker and his water... Bless the coming and going of him.  May his passage cleanse the world. DUKE LETO (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. A spice miner turns and sees Kynes, who remains silent.
SPICE MINER #1 (astonished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liet! SPICE MINER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh. Paul hears this, then looks to Kynes -- locks on his image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing down and yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are about to witness something few have seen -- watch!  Watch! Paul looks down as the Duke banks over the harvester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static electricity is IGNITING in the air and the sand is swirling around the harvester.  Then they see it.  A wide hole emerges from the sand, glistening spokes within it. The hole is twice the size of the harvester.  Suddenly the machine turns and slides into the hole, parts of it EXPLODING.  The SOUND is deafening.  The Duke's ship is WHINING to stay aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gods, what a monster. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is going to pay for this... I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice -- as he studies the Duke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Duke is more concerned over his men than the spice!  I must admit... against all better judgement... I like this Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109. through 113B.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto walks into the room.  The NIGHT GUARD comes to attention as he passes.  DUNCAN IDAHO, wearing a dark, dusty stillsuit, emerges from the shadows.  DUKE LETO and DUNCAN meet at the foot of the steps.  The men embrace and separate. DUKE LETO (happily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan!  What have you discovered about the Fremen, Duncan -- tell me.  Why haven't we heard from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lord... I suspect so much.  I think they are the allies we seek... they are strong and fierce... they do not give their loyalty easily or quickly....  As you know, the Imperium has never been able to take a census of the Fremen.  Everyone thinks that there are but few -- wandering here and there in the desert.... My lord, I suspect an incredible secret has been kept on this planet... that the Fremen exist in vast numbers... vast numbers... and it is they that control Arrakis. 115. through 116.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: DUKE LETO'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard.  Open the door. Paul is in a fitful sleep.  Leto enters and smiles at his son. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well... my son. The Duke smiles at Paul then leaves the room, but after he goes, Paul strains with all his might to lift himself to call out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling painfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!... father... drugged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARON's face --  expressionless.  The SOUND of his ship screams in the background.  The DOCTOR is seated beside him.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Duke walks down the steps to a very narrow passageway.  The passageway becomes very dark. Suddenly the Duke hears a strange MEWLING sound.  He turns down an even darker passageway.  He can hear the shield WHINING in the distance.  He almost has to feel his way.  Up ahead he sees a shape.  He bends down and sees the SHADOUT MAPES dying on the cold stone floor in the darkness.  She tries to speak but cannot.  She falls.  Suddenly the Duke HEARS the shield generator start whining down. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  What? (as Mapes dies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shield! The Duke reaches to activate his shield be a large dart is shot into his shoulder.  The Duke lurches upwards then tumbles to the ground.  Out of the darkness comes Dr. Yueh.  The dart drops and CLATTERS as if a dream. DUKE LETO (CONT'D) (mind racing -- struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yueh! (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sabotaged the house generators, we're wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with self-disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've brought House Atreides down.  I've destroyed the new army's weirding modules. DUKE LETO (hoarse whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Why? The generator WHINES lower and lower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to kill a man... not you, my dear Duke, but the Baron....  You were dead already... but you will be close to the Baron before you die.  You will be tied and drugged but you can still attack. When you see the Baron you will have a new poison tooth.  He will want you close so he can gloat over you.  One bite on this tooth and a strong exile... DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refuse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! -- You mustn't... for in return I will save the lives of your Paul and Jessica. Yueh removes the Duke's signet ring and shows it to him. YUEH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Paul... He implants the tooth. Yueh becomes more and more blurred.  His image begins to fade.  His lips move in the darkness.  The generator WHINE is low and going lower and lower. YUEH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you see the Baron, remember the tooth!  The tooth! 119. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: ATREIDES GUARD #1 comes running down the steps and up to the CAPTAIN and a TECHNICIAN. ATREIDES GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shield is down!  The shield is down!

dialogues.speaker: ATREIDES GUARD CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Harkonnen... (turns and shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that shield up!
