dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning TONE begins.  TROOPS begin pouring onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops race toward their ships. 119D.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATREIDES GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shield!  The shield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud warning TONE vibrates.  Thufir turns away from the doorway of a small room where he's horrified to SEE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a chemical FIRE consuming the thousands of Atreides weirding modules. 121. through 121A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand Harkonnen ships dive over Arrakeen and the Palace.  Giant deep thunderous EXPLOSIONS shatter the land.  Billowing SMOKE clouds column upwards, forming a black wriggling death curtain around the Palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops are running through the passageway, right and left.  SMOKE is everywhere and the horrible SOUNDS of the explosions continue.  The SOUNDS of stone crunching, shifting, and breaking.  SCREAMS.  A wall of stone suddenly cracks open.  A burst of air and dust shoots out, HISSING.  The Duke's dog runs through the passageway WHINING with fear.
125. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sardaukar rush out of a Harkonnen ship.  Their electrically distorted faces come screaming toward us. 125B.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harkonnen hammer ships thunder the ground, sending cracks and fissures throughout the landing field. Harkonnen scare SIRENS scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atreides soldiers run from the hammer ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE and SMOKE.  SCREAMS.  An ATREIDES SOLDIER's head is hit with a large white hot piece of explosion.  Through the black smoke, large SARDAUKAR chase after THREE SOLDIERS and them with hydraulic knife-guns.  One blade enters the back of one man's head and comes out his nose.  Tremendous NOISE of battle.  Gurney and a squad of TROOPERS climb through bodies and thick smoke.  Gurney has the Duke's dog safely inside his coat.  The little dog's head sticks out -- looking about.  Gurney strokes the dog's neck when the reach safety behind some rock.  Small glimpses, as the smoke moves this way or that, let them see thousands of Sardaukar fighting.

dialogues.speaker: LONG LIVE DUKE LETO
dialogues.text: TROOPERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live Duke Leto! The CRY from the men rings out as they attack with frenzy equalling that of the Sardaukar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant HAMMERING of the Harkonnen hammer ship. Jessica's eyes open and she sees two big boots but they seem to be floating above the stone floor she is lying on.  She is gagged and tied.  She looks up. She sees the huge Baron Harkonnen staring down at her.  In the distance she HEARS the battle raging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug was timed.  Dr. Yueh has been very valuable to us....  What a pity you must remain gagged.  We can't let ourselves be swayed by your witch's Voice, now, can we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leto... where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Yueh covers his face with his hands in a darkened room... sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Baron floats across the room with suspensor- borne lightness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Jessica and goodbye to your sweet son....  I want to spit once on your head... just some spittle on your face -- what a luxury. He spits on her cheek.  The Baron floats out of the room into the passageway. BARON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were ordered to kill them... so kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your orders, Piter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them to the desert, as the traitor suggested and worms will destroy the evidence.  Their bodies must never be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Jessica, rubbing the spittle around on her face with his hand, delicately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd thought of many pleasures with you. It is perhaps better that you die in the innards of a worm.  Desire clouds my reason....  That is not good... that is bad.

dialogues.speaker: EFFECT
dialogues.text: Duncan Idaho kills a Sardaukar soldier and rushes forward frantically.  His eyes blaze intensely.  He yells out to the other Atreides soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on this floor somewhere.... The soldiers disappear, searching in another direction.  Duncan runs, pounding, down the passageway -- his eyes searching in every doorway. Suddenly twelve huge Sardaukar round a corner on a quick march.  Duncan turns his shield up and charges them.  Behind them he sees Paul and Jessica bound in straps and being carried. Duncan attacks and fights valiantly but he is outnumbered.  In the fight the lights are blown out and Duncan is killed by a slow stunner pellet through the head.  Paul strains to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Duncan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan!!  Duncan!! Paul and Jessica are carried off, quickly, through the darkness.  The battle SOUNDS thundering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan's dead, shielded body slides sparking in the dark against the passageway walls.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: 131C.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE and SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron's face, the light of FIRE and EXPLOSIONS playing over it.  The Baron turns as Piter ushers in the traitor Yueh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yueh - quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish now to join your wife, is that it, traitor? A sudden flash of hope crosses Yueh's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives? The Baron smiles, almost sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish to join her... join her, then. Piter moves to Yueh, a knife glistening in his hand. It flashes into his back.  A GASP escapes Yueh's throat, a sad look passing over his face, as if to say "I thought as much."  He stands stiffly, then falls gasping.  He tastes his own blood, then dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black smoke palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabban strides in front of his uncle's ship, carrying Kynes over his shoulder.  Harkonnen and Sardaukar SOLDIERS stand at attention.  Rabban tears off Kynes' stillsuit. Kynes falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in the Palace with the Atreides... I also say he was a spy for the Emperor. (looking up to the troops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go now!  Take him to his desert to die. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small `thopter climbs toward the Shield Wall through a SMOKEY atmosphere illuminated by distant EXPLOSIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yueh's sign.  He's left a satchell. Jessica and Paul, bound by cabin straps, lie in the back, the two guards at the controls.  Outside, `thopters and ships fly past them toward the city. The distant FIRES play over Jessica's face as she sees Yueh's triangular tattoo scratched in the cabin roof. HARKONNEN GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to have some fun before we kill her. HARKONNEN GUARD #2 (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... what did you think? Jessica looks to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to use The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch my mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great mother!  He's trying the voice. The Reverend Mother said it could save him. HARKONNEN GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear a noise from the little one?
HARKONNEN GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear anything. HARKONNEN GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? HARKONNEN GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He turns and hits Paul in the shoulder with a stungun.  Paul recovers and starts taking long, calming breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calming exercise. HARKONNEN GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little one! (they laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Guard #1 reaches around and puts his hand up Jessica's skirt.  He starts breathing hard.  Paul clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove her gag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent! Guard #1 finds himself removing Jessica's gag. Guard #2 turns away from his controls but seems powerless to stop him.  Once, it's off Jessica smiles seductively and writhes on the `thopter floor. JESSICA (CONT'D) (The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need to fight over me. The two men stare at one another a moment.  Then Guard #1's hand, glinting silver, flashes into Guard #2's chest, killing him.  Guard #1 pulls the knife out, smiling.  The ornithopter begins to veer off into a dangerous nose dive. HARKONNEN GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First cut my son's bonds.
Guard #1 slowly cuts Paul's big straps, never taking his eyes off Jessica.  The ornithopter gets closer and closer to the top jagged surface of the Shield Wall. JESSICA (CONT'D) (The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. The blade cuts through the strap holding Paul's legs.  Paul kicks upwards extremely powerfully and his foot breaks through the man's chest cavity and drives his heart up into his head, spewing blood out the man's mouth.  Paul grabs the controls but it's too late.  The ship falls into the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The `thopter slides across the rock, shearing off a wing.  Suddenly they are beyond the rock three miles above the great desert and plummeting fast toward the dunes below.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Paul pulls desperately on the controls and manages to keep the ship aloft and flying into the deep desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! 131. through 131A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU violently burning palm.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nefud exits - TWO HARKONNENS wheel in the stretcher, and swing it round - one of the GUARDS hands Piter his knife back - the Guards exit and the door closes - Piter moves up to Duke Leto and leans over him moving his knife across the Duke's face. The Baron flies down to the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto Atreides.  Someone's torn the insignia off your uniform.  Such carelessness. Leto shows no sign that he has heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Feyd. Leto's POV:  The Baron and his Mentat are only DIM FARAWAY SHAPES.  Their voices reach Leto as if travelling across a greater distance.  The Baron looks to Leto and then moves to him, looking him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Feyd? (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Feyd!  Where is the ducal signet ring?  I must have his ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring?... he was brought to us as is, Baron.  I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed the doctor too soon, you fool! DUKE LETO (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yueh... Yueh... dead... Paul and Jessica safe... the tooth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming round, my Lord. The Baron moves from behind a table stacked with dirty dishes and foodstuffs and goes to Leto. DUKE LETO (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... he must be near...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your ring? The Baron's face is now very close to Duke Leto's. BARON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not answer! DUKE LETO (very faint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A... little... closer....  The... water... of my life... for Paul. The Baron briefly wonders at these words and then turns to Piter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crying! (he hits Duke Leto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crying!  He's crying, Piter.  What does he mean? Piter moves forward.  The Baron sees a suculent piece of chicken skin on the table.  He picks up the plate, then the chicken skin. Leto's POV:  It's grown HAZY again.  The Baron is beginning to move away, reaching for the small piece of chicken skin.  Piter leans close to Leto. DUKE LETO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! We hear a CRUNCH, hear a tumultuous RUSHING SOUND as Piter's face is pushed forcibly away.  The Baron is turning, a dumbfounded look on his face.  He drops the plate, and backs away. There is a tremendous ROARING.  Bits of visions of Caladan rush through Leto's ever-darkening consciousness --

dialogues.speaker: MENTAL IMAGES
dialogues.text: 134. through 134A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atreides banner, the green of it, then the black.  The blackness flaps; then all fades to SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they fly deeper into the desert with the ship shuddering and straining, Jessica suddenly cries out with tremendous premonition and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leto!  Leto! Tears course down her cheeks as Paul turns to her. JESSICA (CONT'D) (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leto!  He's dead!  He's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have NO FEELINGS!!  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Leto and Piter lie dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron floats near the ceiling in a small passageway.  He is ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alive!!!  I'm alive!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is fighting the controls of the Harkonnen `thopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harkonnen `thopter lights on dunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't maintain any altitude... we'll never reach the safety of rock.  Maybe that small rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The South Polar regions... the forbidden area.  We must make it to that rock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The `thopter violently hits the sands and flips up - - almost turning over.  It falls slowly back,  then slides down the side of a dune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! He jumps out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring these satchels! She hands him one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry -- This crashing may bring a worm. As Paul puts the satchel over his shoulder, he feels something.  He looks at his father's ring.  He stares at it silently, then closes his hand around it.  They jump outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million deaths are not enough for Yueh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)(reacting to his mother's tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my feelings... I feel for no one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jessica running.  Paul pulls Jessica to a place in the wall where a small overhang offers shelter.  Jessica falls to the ground.  She CRIES, pouring out her grief, but soon the sound of it is carried away by the building rush of WIND.  Paul turns and looks out to the open desert, this portion of which is a dust ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mouse Moon has risen. Ripples of dust undulate tide-like in the light of the moon.  The WHISPERING grains billow up like the foam of waves as they hit the rock.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Paul turns, his face illuminated by the two moons above.  His eyes lock on the moon which has the image of the mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second moon... from the dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move into Paul's eye, where the mouse moon appear and revolves slowly.  The moon begins to explode. The pieces of the moon soar toward us burning with white-hot flames.  Within the flames we see... 139. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the burning Palace of Arrakeen.  We move closer to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We then see Duke Leto's face.  The Baron leans over the Duke and clutches the skin on the Duke's face. He begins pulling it.  The skin on the Duke's race slowly rips open -- making a hideous tearing SOUND. Black SMOKE issues forth from the hole which teats larger. PAUL (V.O.) (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House Atreides is ruined. (less distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This moon holds my past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside and through the SMOKE Paul sees Feyd tear the Red Duke insignia off his father's uniform.  He sees Feyd laughing.  The moving, now-brilliant red hawk insignia becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a burning meteor ROARING over the castle on Caladan.  The meteor crashes in the black sea. PAUL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This moon holds my future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foaming confusion turning into a small, twisting fetus under the sea.  Its eyes closed.  Moving close to it, its eyes snap open.  Through the eyes is the pale white face of JESSICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a huge soaring WIND sound and beyond JESSICA the dunes roll like ocean waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon continues to spew out pieces of moving images which are seen then disappear as fast as sparks.  The broken, burning pieces float eerily toward us over the undulating dunes below.  One image floats closer.  It is a hand folded into a fist. PAUL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am only a seed... The fist begins to open. DUKE LETO (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seed must grow. The hand opens fully with slow blue fluid pulsating out the very center of the palm.  The hand floats eerily forward. DUKE LETO (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeper must awaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last image which passes is foaming and spitting dark blue water.  As the image passes, the black smoke trailing behind it obscures the picture to blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the darkness we move to Paul's clenched hand.  It opens, revealing the signet ring in the very center of his palm.  Paul looks upward to the moons of Arrakis.  He looks back to the ring, then to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!... you wanted to know about my dreams... and I've just had a waking dream... do you know why?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm yourself/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spice!  It's in everything here.  The air, the soil, the food...  It's like the Truthsayer drug.....  It's a poison!!!! You knew the spice would change me.  But thanks to your teachings it's changed my consciousness.  I can see it... I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You carry my unborn sister in your womb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your Bene Gesserit sisterhood... I'm not your Kwisatz Haderach...  I'm something different, something unexpected! (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a seed. (out load)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so much more...  You don't begin to know me... 141. through 142A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's head goes down.  He places the ring on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father... now I have become a killer and I will continue to kill until I have avenged your death. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! Jessica cries as she stares at her son. 143. through 143A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rabban stops up the ramp.  He wears a large smile. His thick head sweats and sweat runs down his thick neck.  He goes inside and the doors swing closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the ship and moves down within to the Baron's headquarters, passing two dwarves cooking a dead legless cow which hangs from chains.  Rabban tears out the cow's tongue and eats it.  Then he exits through a door which closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron is flying wildly, circling the outside of a large steel shower, while Nefud and a DWARF play a strange instrument producing maniacal, perverse, screaming MUSIC.  The Baron SEES Rabban enter, but continues to fly around the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabban!!... we're knee deep in Atreides blood!  We've gutted them.  We've gutted them! (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron floats to Rabban and begins lovingly massaging Rabban's massive neck as he speaks to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabban, Rabban...  I place you in charge of Arrakis.  It's yours to squeeze, as I promised.  I want you to squeeze and squeeze and squeeze. (massaging in rhythm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me spice!  Drive them into utter submission.  You must not show the slightest pity or mercy... as only you can...  Never stop! (releasing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go....  Show no mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my lord Baron. Rabban leaves just as Feyd steps out of the shower. The Baron turns to him lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Feyd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when we've crushed these people enough I'll send in you Feyd... they'll cheer you as a rescuer... lovely Feyd... really a lovely boy. (suddenly he smiles and screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rabban leaves, he looks into one room of the ship.  Behind the glass porthole sits Thufir Hawat bound head and foot, his eyes darting this way and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jessica are in stillsuits.  Paul is looking through a Fremkit.  He finds a paper with Dr. Yueh's mark on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yueh's left the plans for the weirding modules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moons have moved further across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: 148A. BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Suddenly Paul turns and studies his mother.  A stronger WIND comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get to that mountain of rock. We have entered the time when all will turn against us and seek our lives... Jessica gets up.  They make their way up the crest of a dune by a small rock. PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's further than I thought... a worm is sure to come....  I'll plant a thumper, that should divert it.

Paul moves off into the shadows.  Suddenly, Jessica SEES a burst of LIGHTNING illuminate the mountain of rock in the distant and the vast dunes before them. JESSICA (CONT'D) (inner voice)(as Paul leaves to light the thumper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the night is a tunnel... a hole into tomorrow... if we're to have a tomorrow... 149. through 151.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul plants the thumper which begins a powerful rhythmic noise.  He turns to Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember... walk without rhythm and we won't attract a worm... it'll go to the thumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts in her noseplug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Paul and Jessica move into camera and exit right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another burst of LIGHTNING.  The distant rock seems to have grown no larger.  Their muscles begin to ache.  Suddenly they HEAR the thumper start behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their breathing becomes very labored.  The sand moves like slow water, forever rolling down and up. Then they hear the worm, the low thundering HISS shaking the tonnage of sand.  The thumper stops. Paul turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deafening! Their bodies ache and they feel like dropping, yet the cliff is still a good distance away.  The worm SOUND grows louder and Paul turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of LIGHTNING.  The worm is now coming toward them.  The mound of sand over the worm is enormous and is approaching at a terrifyingly fast speed. The power of this worm is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I can't. She turns to see.  Then she runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once their feet tromp down on firmer sand. The SOUND is very loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drum sand! The DRUMMING sound ECHOES deep within the ground. Jessica falls.  Paul stops and drags her up.  They run again.  The worm SOUND becomes unbearably loud. Static electricity SPARKS giant bolts of pure white LIGHTNING and the air turns to ozone.  Finally they find rock.  Behind them the SOUND of the worm changes.  They turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gigantic head of the worm is just breaking through the sand.  The mouth begins to open in an eighty-foot circle of teeth and darkness.  The mouth arches forward searching for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jessica climb up and up inside a narrow slit of rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm's mouth climbs higher also but it cannot penetrate the narrow opening in the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jessica have scrambled upwards a couple of hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still the worm stretches up to them.  Suddenly the worm begins BANGING on the rock.  Huge SHUDDERS drive through the black stone.  Over and over again the worm mindlessly hits at the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jessica crouch further back in the tiny passageway of safety, but a solid back wall of rock prevents them from moving back any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The breath from the worm is like a hurricane of WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnamon... the spice! (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you smell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the secret.  The worm is the spice... the spice is the worm. 157. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a colossal section of the rock wall cracks and topples off into the worm's mouth.  Instantly the worm pulls back.  A huge FIRE roars deep within the worm consuming the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm now can get even closer to Paul and Jessica.  It looms up again and crushes its mouth up against the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another fissure opens, and suddenly half the rock wall protecting them splits off entirely and falls... taking Paul with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...against the worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is knocked off the cliff and falls straight down two hundred feet.  His feet skid along the face of rock.  He bounces and brakes.  He hits and jumps. He careens from one boulder, flies upside down, rights himself then tumbles and skids into the sand. Unhurt, he jumps up and scrambles up another part of the rock to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! She presses against the narrow ledge that is left after the worm assault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm is just coming up again when distant THUMPING is heard.  The worm, as if charmed by the sound, turns and moves off towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thumper. 161A.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica climbs further up and manages to get over to a place where she can meet up with Paul, who is now climbing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened?...  Why did it leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing heavily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone started another thumper....  We're not alone. They climb upwards until the ledge ends at the mouth of a dark crevice.  Paul and Jessica try to see into the inky black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly Paul and Jessica enter, inching forward.  A low moan of WIND comes up.  Paul can see nothing, then suddenly he SEES stars above and SEES the hint of stairs cut into the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man-carved steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... They climb the steps and enter an extremely narrow dark channel of stone.  As they make their way through the rock, suddenly there is a burst of lightning which illuminates a whole troop of Fremen standing silently in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps these are the ones Mapes told us of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trained in the ways of the desert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but many consider my training valuable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take the boy-man... he shall have sanctuary in my tribe...

A LOW NOTE on a dip stick is blown by one of the Fremen tribe.  Jessica shifts, Paul sees it, and just as Stilgar begins a reach for his weapon, Jessica turns, slashes out, utters a SOUND, whirls again and with rock behind her holds Stilgar helpless in front of her -- her hand at his throat. Paul moves on her first move.  He races up a rocky incline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then jumps higher up and presses himself between two rocks on a low cliff overlooking the rest of the Fremen troop.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FREMEN PLACE
dialogues.text: The troop starts shooting projectile weapons in Paul's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Get back!!  She has the weirding way.  Why didn't you tell us!  Great gods... if you can do this to the strongest of us you're worth ten times your weight of water.  As a leader of my people I give you my bond: teach us this weirding way and you both shall have sanctuary.  Your water shall mingle with our water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will teach you our way of battle....  you have the word bond of a Bene Gesserit. A FREMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the legend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the rock, Paul turns.  He takes a step, then notices a small figure standing in front of him.  It is a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Chani, daughter of Liet....  I would not have permitted you to harm my tribe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From my dream... so beautiful.  Liet.... is this Kynes' daughter? Paul stares at her in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.  I'll show you an easier way down. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul, as they meet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have strength... real strength... You shall be known as Usul, which is the strength of the base of the pillar.  This is your secret name in our troop.  But you must choose the name of manhood which we will call you openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you call the mouse shadow in the second moon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call that one Muad'dib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I be known as Paul Muad'dib?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Paul Muad'dib, and your mother shall be a Sayyadina among us....  We welcome you. Wind blows a cloud of dust through the rock.  High above the moon with the mouse shadow glows brilliantly.  It dissolves into the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Jessica and the Fremen march through the dunes. 171. through 171B.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAT WAVES and sand dunes.  Mysterious SOUNDS echo in the distance as the giant sun is setting. Chani takes Paul to the top of a dune.  They stare at the sunset and a huge rock outcropping in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seitch Tabr. Paul looks at the rock, then turns to her. CHANI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me of your homeworld, Usul. These words rend Paul's soul.  He cannot speak.  He reaches out and touches her hand - her cheek. 173. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fremen troop enters into a large square room with slot passageways going off in various directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all move down one of the passageways which are beautifully but very plainly cut with lasguns.  They are like passages in the pyramids, dark with sharp turns and inclines upwards or downwards, some very steep and long, and others descending hundreds of feet.  There is a strong, moaning WIND. 176. through 177.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet WIND can be heard -- deep and moaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moisture... She looks at Paul.  He, too, notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind traps... huge ones. Down a long, sloping, narrow passageway they go until they reach a stairway cut into the stone.  It is very dark and gets increasingly darker as they descend.  The WIND sound grows.  The air grows colder and damper.  Paul and Jessica share another questioning look.  At the bottom of the stairs they pass through a narrow slot doorway which suddenly opens out on something so totally unexpected it shocks Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is enormous, deep reservoir of black water sitting silently in the depths of this sietch and stretching out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water on Arrakis!!! I have seen this place in a dream. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greater than treasure, Usul.  We have thousands of such caches.  Only a few of us know them all.  When we have enough... we shall change the face of Arrakis. Listen!... There is the sound of water dripping.  The lights are extinguished - reflections play on Paul's face. STILGAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rocks of Arrakis hold many secrets. 179A. through 180   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: 180A. REVISED SCENE
dialogues.text: Thousands of Fremen wait below.  Paul enters a rock ledge, guided by two monks, which is crowded with Fremen and old Fremen Monks.  Below the crowds continue to watch and wait while a giant wind organ moans.  A Monk steps up to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sense that you may be the "voice from the outer world".  Both moons told us of you.  You must pass tests before we will know... you must conquer the beast of the desert, both his outer and his deadly inner powers. (moves back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to us... from the outer world. Paul turns and gathers courage to address the multitude below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am only a seed. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Usul... Paul Muad'dib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud murmur)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muad'dib!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever dreamed there would be so many. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our shared enemy the Harkonnens, are once again in control of Arrakis.  Stilgar, your leader, has asked me and my mother to crush the Harkonnens.  We must do more than this.  We must totally destroy all spice production on Arrakis.  The Guild and the entire universe depends on spice. "He who can destroy a thing, controls a thing". I will take one hundred of your warriors and train them.  This one hundred will train the thousands that remain.  When the spice flow stops, all eyes will turn to Arrakis.  The Baron and the Emperor himself will be forced to deal with us. Arrakis will become the center of the Universe. (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dream unfolds. 181. through 181A.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large room with a low ceiling.  A drummer playing makes a low ECHOING MUSICAL HIT.  A big block of stone is moved across coarse sand -- back and forth -- fast.  A rhythm is started -- powerful.  Paul enters, pauses and looks to Jessica - he stands in front of over 100 Fremen men.  Jessica sits behind him alongside Stilgar. A large rock obelisk has been placed near Paul for this demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weirding way has long been a Bene Gesserit secret.  With my mother's help, my father isolated an element of the weirding way and externalised it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the Harkonnen treachery, my father's armies were never able to fully develop this new form.  This is what I will teach you.  You will be the fiercest and most feared fighters in the Universe. Our way of battle is built on rhythm.  You understand rhythm like this but you do not yet understand the rhythm of the higher sounds, sounds that heal and build... sounds that destroy.  Motion is the base. You understand the motion... but you do not yet understand the motion that heals and builds... motions that destroy... Orato! (he moves forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This obelisk is of your hardest stone. Kick it... (he does -- the rock doesn't move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it... (he does -- the rock doesn't move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yell at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break! The Fremen laugh -- the rock doesn't move. A Fremen with a lasgun tries to cut it.  Paul motions him back, slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move back! Paul also moves back.  He switches on his weirding module.  He opens his mouth and makes a small SOUND, which the module amplifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuksa! The sound shatters the obelisk to pieces.  The one hundred Fremen YELL with surprise and awe. 100 FREMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Achiii!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is part of the weirding way that we will teach you.  Some thoughts have a certain sound... that being the equivalent to a form.  Through sound and motion you will be able to paralyze nerves, shatter bones, set fires, suffocate an enemy or burst his organs....  We will kill until no Harkonnen breathes Arrakeen air. 100 FREMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muad'dib!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To avenge my father, I will turn you into killing machines. Stilgar turns to Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayyadina.  Our Reverend Mother tells me she is too old... She has been calling through space and time for you to come and let her rest.  She asks that you pass within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to take the Water of Life... the Truthsayer drug... so dangerous, yet... we must move swiftly if we're to secure our place among these Fremen. (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will try to pass within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death may be the result....  Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must do this for Paul, but what of my unborn child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 183. through 187.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fremen carry the Fremen REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO in on a litter.  The old Reverend Mother is old a frail yet extremely beautiful and mysterious.  She turns to Paul and Jessica with a strange look.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO
dialogues.text: (to Jessica, in an ancient voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are the ones. She turns away towards the monks who are very busy blowing horns and waving pots of burning spice, purifying the area of the rite.  Several Fremen blow on dip sticks and a FEMALE CHOIR begins a haunting chorale as the giant pipe organ blows beautiful low notes below. Paul looks to his mother. He then sees Chani. CU Chani. CU Paul -- he cannot stop looking at her. Stilgar motions to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the Water of Life?... Come... ...Watch... the mystery of mysteries... the end and the beginning. He shows Paul through a narrow passageway -- almost a slot through the stone to a small room.  Through an opening in the stone wall, Paul is shown a very strange and somewhat horrifying scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thirty-foot baby worm is being lowered into a stone chamber.  The chamber is then covered with a wire top.  Valves are turned and water rushes into the chamber.  The worm begins to writhe violently and leap and bang against the bars above.  The worm begins to turn inside out from the mouth back and it begins to gag.  Some monks and watermasters quickly drain the stone chamber and wrench the worm out using large steel hooks.  They hold the worm above a large tub.  A watermaster-reed man runs a long reed in to the worm, causing it to spasm and gag up a beautiful deep blue bile as it dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bile and worm water are combined in ceremonial containers.  Paul turns to Stilgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Water of Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most lethal poison in the Universe. Then we HEAR from Paul's memory his conversation with the Reverend Mother: REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Many men have tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they try and fail? REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried and died.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Stilgar and Paul return to the ledge above the Hall of Rites.  A MONK PRIEST steps forward, addresses the crowd, silencing them.  The other monks move back carrying their smoking cleansing bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One among us has consented to enter the rite.  She will attempt to pass within that we not lose the strength of our Reverend Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)(turning to his mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she should fail? He brings the jug close to Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink! Jessica drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ultimate awareness spectrum narcotic. I must transform the poison configuration within my body... the blue must be made clean. She swallows.  Her body contorts and spasms violently.  She screams.  The Reverend Mother screams with her.
191  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see Jessica sitting, shoulders tight and spasming -- straining, her eyelids half-closed and flickering. 193. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The old Reverend Mother slowly extends a hand toward Jessica's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Inside Jessica, we see the Reverend Mother Ramallo's hand descend through the dark void.  Shimmering water starts to ripple, lightly stirring an image of Jessica. As the hand penetrates, something deep within her starts to GLOW.  It is a fetus, a female.  The Reverend Mother Ramallo's hand flinches as it touches the fetus.  The fetus sparks to life - screaming and rapidly spasming upwards on its umbilical cord. 195A.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO
dialogues.text: (whispering urgently into Jessica's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told us.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Mother!  This changes both!  What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica and the fetus rush mentally through a dark strangely worm-like tunnel until suddenly, a gaping black hole appears.  A horrible WIND, SPARKS and circles of expanding light issues from it. JESSICA (V.O) (inner voice)(fearful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  This is the place where we cannot look.  The place only for the eyes of the Kwisatz Haderach.

dialogues.speaker: 197B. THE FETUS
dialogues.text: The fetus twists down the tunnel to join Jessica, her umbilical cord trailing behind.  She SCREAMS as she looks into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: 197C. THE NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: She and Jessica see a shape moving deep within the windy hole.  It is a Third Stage Navigator, ROARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?...  Is this what kills the men who enter here? She quickly takes the fetus back up the tunnel.  As they move:

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now my daughter and I are both Reverend Mothers.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER RAMALLO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a long time waiting for you. Here is my life.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The old Reverend Mother Ramallo slumps forward onto the stone, dead.  The crowd waits.  The corpse is tenderly removed.  Jessica very slowly opens her eyes and looks about her.  The monk holds the jug to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change it that we may all drink of it.
Jessica spews water into the spout.  The monk swirls the jug, sniffs at the spout and then drinks. MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is changed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fremen suddenly turn their attention to Paul.... They whisper "It is the prophecy!"  They soon begin to CHANT... "Muad'dib....  Muad'dib" over and over again.  The chanting sounds fill the hall along with the ghostly wind organ. 200. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, the crowds continue CHANTING "Muad'dib, Muad'dib."

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Paul continues to stare at Chani.  He moves to her. Chani turns.  Paul is at her side.  Their eyes meet and lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the dark black corridor, Chani turns and she and Paul fall together in a long kiss filled with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chani....  I love you... I've always loved you....
204. through 209.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron and Feyd descend several steps into a darker area of Geidi Prime.  Feyd is carrying a strange creature in a small wire cage.  The Baron is floating as he descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feyd, even though he's aging, Thufir is one of the finest Mentats in the Universe... and he's mine, Feyd... all mine....  Quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nefud stands eating candies behind Thufir's chair. Nefud has a stun gun, even though Thufir's hands are tied.  The Baron enters with Feyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Thufir, I see they've installed your heart plug already....  Don't be angry. Everyone gets one here.  But this is not why we're here.  We've brought you a little cat, Thufir.  You must care for it if you wish to live.  A poison has been introduced into you, Thufir Hawat.  By milking this smooth little cat body each day you receive your antidote... it must be done each day....  Also, you must do something for me if you wish to live.  You know I lost Piter, my dear Mentat... Thufir gives the Baron a weak, wide-eyed stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can see is an Atreides that I want to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feyd, no, no!  Thufir's a Harkonnen now, aren't you Thufir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear Duke... how I have failed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica's face shows signs of straining.  Women move around her, Chani and Harah at her side, helping her give birth.  Suddenly ALIA is born and her freshly- born moist body is held up in front of Jessica. Alia's eyes snap open, burning brightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you call her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia. As they lift Alia for Jessica to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks down the steps into the training room - followed by Harah's two sons.  He pauses at the foot of the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate your weirding modules... Paul activates his, and the Fremens follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set the range for two meters. Paul walks down the line of Fremen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korba... (points to robot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aiming the module)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuuk-sa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion... Chuuk-sa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuuuk-sa... He fires the module and the arm of the robot is shot off.  Paul smiles and hits him on the shoulder - Paul walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stilgar... One of the FREMEN calls out to Paul. A FREMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muad'dib!... The word `Muad'dib' causes a tremendous power to build.  The module shakes violently in his hand - it suddenly fires upwards, and the wall explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own name is a killing word.  Will it be a healing word as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul as he applies red colour to the shoulders of several large Fremen men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usul... these are fifteen of our fiercest fighters to serve you as your guard... the Fedaykin. He pauses, then holds up his brilliantly red hand. 212. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION.  Paul turns and his eyes are totally blue.  He lifts binoculars to them and looks.  He sees the Fremen fighters below charging at the Harkonnens.  As the Fremen run they make powerful SOUNDS with their weirding modules, exploding everything in their path and catching things on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, a huge spice carryall is shot down and it falls to the ground EXPLODING more violently on impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!
Stilgar signals, and Fremen run behind them. PAIL (CONT'D) (to Stilgar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're even better on the battlefield than in the training rooms!! (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound... as a weapon.  If only you could see them, father. Paul smiles as he looks at the battle in the distance. PAUL (CONT'D) (his V.O. from the past)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the spice flow stops, the entire Universe will turn to Arrakis.  The Baron and the Emperor himself will be forced to deal with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabban stares dumbfounded as many Harkonnen wounded and dead are brought through the passageway beyond. Rabban grabs a Harkonnen and asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  What happened to you? What is he saying? WOUNDED HARKONNEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muad'dib!...  Muad'dib!... Muad'dib!... Muad'dib! Rabban pushes him away. A HARKONNEN SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been repeating that name ever since we found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Muad'dib?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAT WAVES; dunes.  A big thumper is forced into the sands.  A RHYTHM is heard pounding on Fremen hand drums and rhythm instruments.  Feet scramble.  Black stillsuited Fedaykin warrior bodyguards gather. Stilgar turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usul... It is time you become a sandrider... and travel as a Fremen.  Take the kiswa maker hook of our sietch and ride as a leader of men. 216. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paul leaves the troop to plant the second thumper: STILGAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thumpers are planted.  The worm may not surface for the first - he will rise for the second.  Remember, when the worm approaches, you must be utterly still... and close enough to plant the hook firmly under a ring segment....  The worm will turn to lift this exposed area as far from the abrasive sand as possible and it will take you with it -- to the top.  Do not get too close as he approaches... the sand will engulf you....  Wait till the head of the worm passes -- then go... quickly. STILGAR & FREMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shai-Hulud... Shai-Hulud. In the distance the telltale SOUND of the worm's approach begins.  This worm is deep underground and the sound is low and the ground trembles violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the very strong ones travel this deep.... The SOUND and VIBRATIONS continue to build.  In the distance, the Fedaykin and Stilgar watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usul has called a big one.  Again... it is the legend. 218. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAT WAVES... dunes RHYTHM.  THUNDEROUS approach of the worm.  Paul still cannot see the worm, but the sound begins to drown out the Fremen rhythm instruments and the sand begins to VIBRATE. Suddenly, Paul SEES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a mountain of sands rise up, towering, thundering -- lightning SPARKS fissuring throughout the air above the worm. The mountain approaches at a terrifying speed. Then, the worm appears -- rushing.  The mouth, at first a small opening, begins to widen -- exposing a thousand glistening teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul freezes.  He lets the worm get closer and closer.  The HEAT WAVES distort the gigantic form, making it more hideous -- more foreign.  He moves forward.  The others watch anxiously.  This worm is big.  It is so much larger than imaged.  Its top towers 125 feet in the air.  The segments are each ten feet wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gets close and running alongside, he plants the hook under a segment and pulls back.  The SOUND is excruciatingly loud.  The sand is so deep and more is being thrown out beneath the body of the worm. Paul gets caught in it and falls. He narrowly escapes being sucked under the beast.  He gets up -- runs again and plants the hook once more.  He runs faster, bending the segment open to expose the tender flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the worm begins to turn.  Paul pulls himself up the body as it turns -- holding onto the hook.  Soon he is fifty -- sixty -- seventy feet off the ground -- going higher.  The giant worm gets the second thumper and Paul at that moment climbs to the top.  He plants the second hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sandrider!... Paul works the hooks into the breathing holes along the body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...causing the great beast to make a slow turn toward Stilgar and the bodyguard.  They set themselves and as the worm passes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they all clamber on, climbing up the sides to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live the fighters! They return the traditional CALL and Paul steers the maker in a giant circle.  They head out across the dunes. 219G.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabban and Harkonnens in the desert.  Rabban observes tremendous destruction of his spice harvesters and carryalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen Great Houses of the Lansraad have reported a significant delay in delivery of spice per CHOAM agreement. This constitutes a serious violation of CHOAM codes.  Contact Baron Vladimir Harkonnen immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious Rabban sirs in a black steel tub in the Great Hall.  A squad of TROOPS stands at attention in front of him, listening to his screaming fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falsify the reports.  We can't hide it all, tell them we've lost only two hundred harvesters... and forty carryalls... and don't let my uncle know about the destruction of the spice silos....  I will catch this Muad'dib and suck the blood from him!!  SUCK THE BLOOD FROM HIM!!!
219J. through 222.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMOKE billows from a burning harvester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting is going on between Fremen and some smugglers.  Paul moves down a smokey dune with Stilgar followed by Fremen and Fedaykin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We surprised a band of smugglers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racing into thick smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad... thought they were Harkonnen. Paul and Stilgar move through the smoke.  A man runs up with a maula pistol aimed at Paul but Paul spins and punctures the man's chest with a sound from his weirding module.  Paul turns and a large figure comes through the smoke.  They surprise each other. The figure holds a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gurney!... The figure stops -- stunned. PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've no need of your weapons with me Gurney Halleck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering; whisper of hope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!!  Paul!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you trust your own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you were dead.  They said... Paul shows him the signet ring on his fingers. Gurney moves forward, his eyes tearing, and the two embrace each other and pound each other on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You young pup!  You young pup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand-by... warning... we have just received a coded threat from the Guild. Spice production is in serious jeopardy... Giedi Prime supplying false reports... Guild to visit Emperor in one standard day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor sits on his throne.  Behind him are his Sardaukar officers.  In front of him are several Guildsmen.  One holds a large electrical apparatus up to the face plate of another which translates his strange voice into English. TANKED GUILDSMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emperor Shaddam IV... You have one last chance to take matters into your own hands and bring the situation under the control on Arrakis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean one last... TANKED GUILDSMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not speak!...  Listen!...  You do not have more than this one chance....  I represent the entire Guild in this matter....  You have failed to kill the Atreides heir... Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was said to... TANKED GUILDSMEN #2 (moans like a cow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooo... he is not dead.  He is not eaten by worms as you have wanted to believe.  He is not missing.  He is in the deep desert with the Fremen.  The Spice is in great danger.  We are not asking... we are telling... remedy the situation or you will live out your life in a pain amplifier. The Guildsmen turn and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Paula Atreides to the Guild? And why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica sits with Harah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Reverence, I don't wish to upset you, but the other women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the passageway, standing alone -- staring with powerful intense blue-within-blue eyes -- is ALIA.  She's listening mentally. HARAH (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they don't like Alia around.  She frightens them.  It is the strangeness of your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the way she speaks of things... Alia is listening - then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia listens mentally. JESSICA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...beyond her years and of things no child could know -- things of the past. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia begins walking.  She appears to be angry.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A daughter who knew at birth everything I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Your Reverence, they won't have her around them. Alia enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming little adult voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harah!  Would they deny me the right to use this mind?...
ALIA (CONT'D) (using The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would they deny me the right to use this voice?... Harah's head nearly bursts with pain and she SCREAMS as if she were dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia! 226A.     (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want fifty legions of Sardaukar on Arrakis at once. SARDAUKAR OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty legions?... (he looks at the other officers with worry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our entire reserves as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is genocide...  the deliberate and systematic destruction of all life on Arrakis.

dialogues.speaker: 228A. NEW SCENE
dialogues.text: Ships over Arrakis. 229. through 230.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a growing, powerful sound of a worm approaching as Paul and Chani are lying together in the darkness of their sleeping chamber.  Paul's eyes snap open and he sees Chani looking down at him (the last image of the future in the desert).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were calling my name... it frightened me.
Page Missing

In the hollow of a huge dune, Paul stops with Chani. They share a look into each other's eyes.  Paul turns towards the Fedaykin and nods.  They move in quickly to tie and wrap Paul in Fremen rope.  They move back and wait quietly.  Chani moves in very close to Paul.  She holds a glass vial of the blue water of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!  All I see is darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul... I will love you forever... in life or in death... let Shai-Hulud judge now. (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my life. She pours the blue liquid into Paul's mouth.  Slow move into Paul's face as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... the test of the water of life... what is it that waits for me in this darkness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade to black then dissolves to dark blue fluid.  A blue drop falls into the blue fluid - a huge low thud - then quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to Paul screaming horribly in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia walks forward in the very dark room.  Blood rushes from her nose.  She forces herself to walk to Jessica's bed.  She finds that Jessica's nose is bleeding also.  Jessica wakes in pain.  They stare at each other in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother - help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia!  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Paul.  He's taken the Water of Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to quiet black - dissolve again to blue - another drop - low thud - quietness - fade to black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor's space ship soars towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reverend Mother Helen Mohiam is on the floor, bleeding from the nose and weak from pain.  The Emperor looks on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly screaming towards us is white rings, stars and a huge Guild Navigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to Paul's eyes - tightly closed, oozing fresh blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING SOUND.  Paul's mouth opens and a giant wind is stirred on the desert. 234. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navigator chewing giant eye and spewing blood and light and sounds.  Paul's mouth double exposes over Navigator and eye.  The sound from Paul's mouth destroys the Navigator and opens the Alam. Navigator bursts into a huge light ring and we quickly travel through ring after ring and masses of liquid stars.  The light increases until it is blinding and then in the light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A golden flower blossoms and glows brilliantly - suddenly the powerful sound of an approaching worm. 236. through 239.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chani and the Fedaykin freeze and watch in horror as seven giant worms converge on them.  The worms break the desert surface and rise, towering over them. The worms hover and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 241. through 245.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chani looks to the Fedaykin, then they look at Paul who lies motionless.  She cuts the rope bonds with her crysknife.  Her fingers tremble as does the whole of the desert. Paul's eyes snap open.  He sits up slowly.  Chani stares at him in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul... Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge wave crashes and Paul sees the image of his father.  Paul slowly gets to his knees, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!...  Father!  THE SLEEPER HAS AWAKENED. Giant echoes of this phrase reverberate across the vast desert.  The worms bend back into the sand and leave with thundering power. MUSIC FULL. 247. through 250.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Rock Ledge of Sietch Tabr is filled with Fedaykin and monks; Chani, Jessica, Gurney and Stilgar stand together near the back.  Paul moves out on the Rock Ledge overlooking the Hall of Rites which is crowded with Fremen warriors who chant "Maud'Dib" along with the powerful sounds of the WIND ORGAN and FREMEN war DRUMS. Paul raises his open hand.  SILENCE.  Only the organ continues with a soft low NOTE.  The Fremen wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrakis... Dune... Desert Planet. A quiet, haunting MOAN of recognition of a master rises from the Fremen. PAUL (CONT'D) (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your time has come. (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father... our time has come. (out loud again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm is coming -- our storm... and when it comes it will shake the Universe. Emperor... we come for you. A thunderous ROAR arises.  War DRUMS pound.  The ORGAN blows hurricaine of power through the sietch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he raises crysknife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live the fighters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live the fighters! Fremen carrying weapons begin moving out in long lines from the Hall as the war DRUMS pound. 251A. through 252B. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one `thopter sits the Baron Harkonnen.  He is flown down to the Emperor's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sietch door opens and Fremen warriors stream out.
254. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND is howling and is starting to blow the sand.  Dark sand clouds form in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sietch door opens and hundreds and thousands more Fremen pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Stilgar and Gurney watch the Emperor's enormous ship on the Arrakeen landing field below. 257A. through 258.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of Fremen are running, planting thumpers as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gurney, when the storm hits... set off the atomics.  I want an opening through the entire Shield Wall.  Stilgar?  Do we have wormsign? Stilgar and Gurney laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usul... We have wormsign, the likes of which even God has never seen. Paul smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down over the huge desert it looks like a living sea of wormsign.  Everywhere ripples appear and worms are surfacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of Fremen are running, positioning themselves to mount and ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust clouds grow faster and the speed of the WIND increases.  Sand particles hit at a rock outcropping and up close they sound like giant warrior drummers pounding before battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly above come hundreds of SCREAMING space ships zooming down across the desert floor and towards the landing field. 264. (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm is howling now.  Sand blasts against rock and rips pieces away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring in that floating fat man... the Baron. The Baron is brought in.  Distant warning SIGNALS begin.  The Baron is fighting to contain his fear because RABBAN'S HEAD SITS ALL BLOODY ON THE FLOOR in front of him.  Finally the Emperor speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you brought me here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Highness... There must be some mistake... I never requested your presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah?  But your lack of action demanded it. Your dreadful mismanagement, your bad judgement in assigning to Rabban -- (he gestures toward the head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the governorship....  You forced me to come here and set things straight... personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring in the messenger. Alia is brought in by the Sardaukar soldiers.  She is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the messenger from Muad'dib.  Poor Emperor, I'm afraid my brother won't be very pleased with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence!...  I do not court your brother's pleasure. Suddenly the Reverend Mother looks horrified and grabs her throat. REVEREND MOTHER (struggling, speaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill this child!!  She's an abomination!! Kill her. (points to Alia, who is smiling at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my mind!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until you tell them both who I really am. REVEREND MOTHER (strained speech void of emotion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister of Paul Muad'dib. The Reverend Mother slumps.  The Baron's mouth flies open.  The Emperor's face goes pale, his lips tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's sister... Paul is Muad'dib?! He turns quickly and looks at the two Guild agents present in the room.  They stare at him icily.  Alia is smiles happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)(to Gurney and Stilgar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia keeps pace with the storm.
Gurney and Stilgar don't understand.  Suddenly enormous dust clouds and LIGHTNING sweep up over the Shield Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gurney, now! Gurney gives a hand signal and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (they put on their hoods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atomics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...TWENTY EXPLOSIONS of hydrogen bomb intensity go off in a row, cutting a huge gorge through the width of the massive Shield Wall.  As the EXPLOSIONS go off, a WIND howls, destroying much of Arrakeen and covering the rest with tons of sand.  Sand rips at the Palace and the Emperor's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia smiles as they HEAR the tremendous roaring, atomic screams of the explosions.  The Emperor's ship's warning SIGNALS are now close and loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother is coming... with many Fremen warriors. A Sardaukar rushes in. SARDAUKAR OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shield Wall is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not impossible.  I told you... He is here now. SARDAUKAR OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Majesty, into the ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his officers)(rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the Sardaukar.  Baron... give this little abomination to the storm. They all leave the room, including the Sardaukars.
270A. through 271.  (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have her, Majesty! The Baron floats down to her.  Alia turns to him -- still smiling.  With a flash of her hand she reaches out and swipes at the Baron's face.  He CRIES OUT in pain.  She pulls his suspensor plugs and pushes him back, then slowly shows him the tiny needle she holds in her hand.  He spins crazily as he screams from the poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worms, each with hundreds of Fremen on them, come slithering through the newly-formed canyon in the Shield Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul rides the lead worm with Gurney and Stilgar by his side.  The storm is howling and blowing with horrifying intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor and his Sardaukar officers in a darkened room where they are horrified to see on the screens the hundreds of worms which are coming into the Arrakeen valley.  All their faces show fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the wall behind Alia and the spinning Baron is completely blown away by a BLAST. The Baron floats and spins out into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the worms enter the Arrakeen basin they meet the Sardaukar.  The Sardaukar don't have a chance -- the worms suck them up by the hundreds.  The Fremen on the worm's backs fire weapons, killing the few Sardaukar the worms leave behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space ships which were recently airborne are now crashing because of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: 272A. NEW SCENE
dialogues.text: The Baron floats and spins high in the dust clouds of the storm over the Arrakeen Valley.
