dialogues.speaker: 274A. NEW SCENE
dialogues.text: The worm, that Paul, Gurney and Stilgar are riding, suddenly rears up.  Its mouth opens.  The Baron appears as a tiny spinning shape.  He flies directly into the mouth of this collosal worm and is devoured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand Fremen battle Sardaukar outside the Emperor's tent.  They soon overpower them and rush into the giant steel structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire airfield is now filled with wild worms, Fremen, and dead or dying Sardaukar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia moves dreamily among the dying Sardaukar. 279. through 280.   (Deleted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters the Palace hall and the first thing he sees is the giant bull's head.  The horns have been blown off and the Atreides banner has been stuffed and wired into the mouth. A WIND moans through the Palace. Paul turns.  Gurney and several guards bring in the Emperor, Irulan, the Reverend Mother, Sardaukar generals, Guildsmen, Feyd and Thufir.  The Fedaykin and Fremen troops line the walls. Paul's eyes meet Feyd's -- Feyd gives him an evil smile. Paul turns and looks at the Emperor, who stares back defiantly.  Paul moves his gaze to Irulan, who lowers her eyes.  He then sees his old teacher, Thufir Hawat, whose tired eyes wander helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gurney... I see Thufir Hawat among the captives.  Let him stand free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him stand free! The Emperor turns nervously to Feyd, who passes a golden dagger to Thufir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thufir)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antidote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to Thufir)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thufir.  Come. Thufir approaches Paul, concealing the knife.  They come face to face.  The Emperor seems strangely tense at this moment.  Paul notices this.  He looks Thufir over. PAUL (CONT'D) (inner voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knife.... (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In payment of the many years of service to my family, you may know ask of me anything you wish.  Anything at all. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need my life, old friend? He turns his back on him. PAUL (CONT'D) (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is yours. Thufir's eyes grow sad and wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean this, Thufir.  If you are to strike, do it now. Thufir's hand rises, as Jessica gasps, but the old Mentat pulls his heart plug out with a quick tearing motion.  Paul turns and catches him as he sags. His head lolls back and he looks up to Paul urgently.
THUFIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... generations... of you... His breath escapes him and he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry this noble Atreides warrior away. Do him all honor. The guards do as they are instructed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emperor Shadam the IV... there are Guild Heighliners above us containing many Great Houses of the Lansraad....  SEND THEM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you speak to me... GUILDSMAN #2 (speaking into electric microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop your speaking!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Guildsmen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You have some idea of what I would do but I will tell it to one who has never been seen... one who hides deep in the Heighliner control rooms.  He will hear it first. GUILDSMEN #3 (fear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Paul smiles as we move closer and closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we are in the Heighliner control room, near the floor in the chemical spills.  We move up into the orange gas.  THUNDERING begins to shake the Heighliner. PAUL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you....  Let me see you or there will be no spice.
We move into very thick gas and there is a ROARING. Suddenly Paul sees the Third Stage Navigator. PAUL (V.O.)(CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm about to say is true.... I have the power to destroy the spice forever. The Guild Navigator's mouth stretches back in a horrible MOAN.  The moan becomes more pained and grows louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guildsmen in the room are MOANING and SCREAMING and swarming out towards the doorway -- the Fremen stop them.  The Emperor and all are amazed and frightened.  There is a long hush.  The old Reverend Mother then turns and glares at Paul. PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try your powers on me.  Try looking into that place where you dare not look. You'll find me there staring back at you!! You Bene Gesserit have waited ninety generations to produce the one person your schemes required.  Here I stand.  But... I will never be yours. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him, Jessica!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw a part of what the race needs in the beginning.  In time you perverted the truth.  You sought to control human breeding and intermix a select few according to a selfish master plan.  How little you understand. REVEREND MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't speak of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using The Voice)

dialogues.speaker: SILENCE
dialogues.text: The old woman is shot backwards by the power of his shout.  Her breath is knocked out of her. PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember your gom jabbar, now you remember mine.  I can kill with a word.
A Fedaykin stand forward and recites from the prophecy. FEDAYKIN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and his word shall carry death eternal to those who stand against the righteous. Feyd hears this and is angered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The righteous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Emperor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a Harkonnen among you.  Give the Harkonnen a blade and let him stand forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Feyd wishes, he can meet you with my blade in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it. (steps forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Harkonnen animal.  Let me, please, my Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor's blade. Feyd takes up the Emperor's blade with a smile. Paul takes out his crysknife.  They begin to circle each other. Paul smiles, circling still.  Suddenly, Feyd leaps, his blade jabbing savagely outward, but Paul easily evades it, moving away.  They begin to circle again. He makes another pass at Paul that comes dangerously close, but again, Paul is away, a frozen smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why prolong the inevitable?  I will kill you!  I will kill him! Feyd smiles.  He lashes out biting Paul's hand. Feyd LAUGHS in triumph. Feyd leaps forward jabbing, his right hip also forward.  Yet Paul, although a little slowly, again reels away.  Again, Feyd thrusts.
This time Paul jabs with his crysknife, but Feyd moves away effortlessly.  Feyd counters and kicks Paul to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! Paul is up instantly and he circles with Feyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the little one?  A pet, perhaps? Will she deserve my special attentions? Paul jabs out, his crysknife slashing.  Feyd grabs his arm, and Paul his, the two men locked in a straining clinch.  Feyd presses his right hip closer and closer to Paul's body.  Paul strains to keep it away.  Suddenly, the gom jabbar flips out of Feyd's girdle, but on the left side, and he lunges powerfully with it at Paul, who just barely misses taking it in his skin.  He throws Feyd back, but not before Feyd's feet strike out, sending Paul to the floor.  Feyd leaps onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see... your death... my blade will finish you. Suddenly, Paul, with lightning swiftness, pushes Feyd up and over.  He is on top of him in a flash. Paul's crysknife flashes up, thrusting upward through Feyd's jaw.  Feyd's mouth opens as the knife continues up through his tongue and through to his brain.  Feyd's eyes go wild, then glaze over as he jerks dead on the floor.  Paul slowly gets to his feet, breathing heavily.  Anger still seething in him, Paul issues a SOUND -- a loud, horrible, powerful sound, and Feyd's internal organs rupture and the stone floor under him cracks open.  The Fedaykin smile. FEDAYKIN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usul no longer needs the weirding module. Everyone stares in disbelief.  Paul looks to the Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I will tell you how it will be. Irulan shall be my wife, opening the way for an Atreides to take the throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sit on the throne!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will sit on a throne on Selusa Secundus, your prison planet.  Either that or you will die. The Emperor is still.  Paul moves to Chani. PAUL (CONT'D) (to Chani)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess shall have no more of me than my name... no child of mine or touch the softness of glance... nor instant of desire....  This is my promise to you... (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my love. Paul turns back to the others. Jessica turns to Chani and whispers to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think on it Chani... We who carry the name of concubine... history will call us wives. Alia enters with two monks.  She signals and one of them places a cloak over Paul's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fremen have the word of Muad'dib. They will have their Holy War to cleanse the Universe... they will have Arrakis... Dune... their planet.  There will be flowing water here open to the sky and rich green oases.  For the spice there will always be some desert.  There will be fierce winds and trials to toughen men. We Fremen have a saying... (he stares at the Reverend Mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "God created Arrakis to train the faithful." One cannot go against the word of God. Everyone in the room stares at him soundlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how can this be? There are three powerful drum hits. ALIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For... he is the Kwisatz Haderach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens his mouth and issues an ever increasing wind.  Lightning and thunder begin.  Clouds begin to form over the Palace.  In the half-light of dusk, thousands of Fremen watch the sky.  Giant golden lights are illuminated and their rays shoot far into the sky illuminating the growing clouds.  Five tremendous bolts of lightning suddenly unleash a downpour of RAIN ON ARRAKIS.  The Fremen stand awestruck as they are drenched with water falling from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE MOVE through Paul's glowing blue eyes into beautiful blue luminescent light. A gigantic WIND arises, and suddenly appearing in the blue light is an ocean of light rolling like gold glass off into infinite.  The blue becomes darker and a golden lotus flower blooms in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This script was found in INFlow. It was shameless taken o else, may god, copyright owners and people who worked har credited forgive us.
